'Cetylpyridinium chloride' ('CPC') is a cationic quaternary ammonium compound in
some types of mouthwashes, toothpastes, lozenges, throat sprays, breath sprays,
and nasal sprays. It is an antiseptic that kills bacteria and other
microorganisms. It has been shown to be effective in preventing dental plaque
and reducing gingivitis. It has also been used as an ingredient in
certain pesticides. Cetylpyridinium chloride may cause brown stains between the
teeth and on the surface of teeth. However, these stains can be easily removed by a dentist during a
routine check-up.
